quotes.content: If an item is advertised as "under $50", you can bet it's not $19.95.
quotes.author: McGowan's Madison Avenue Axiom

quotes.content: An unbreakable toy is useful for breaking other toys.
quotes.author: Van Roy's Law

quotes.content: How long a minute is depends on which side of the bathroom door you're on.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.content: Don't worry over what other people are thinking about you. They're too busy worrying over what you are thinking about them.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.content: If you view your problem closely enough you will recognize yourself as part of the problem.
quotes.author: Ducharm's Axiom

quotes.content: Make it possible for programmers to write in English and you will find the programmers cannot write in English.
quotes.author: A Law of Computer Programming

quotes.content: The attention span of a computer is only as long as its electrical cord.
quotes.author: Turnaucka's Law

quotes.content: One good reason why computers can do more work than people is that they never have to stop and answer the phone.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.content: If computers get too powerful, we can organize them into a committee -- that will do them in.
quotes.author: Bradley's Bromide

quotes.content: At the source of every error which is blamed on the computer you will find at least two human errors, including the error of blaming it on the computer.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.content: If you put garbage in a computer nothing comes out but garbage.  But this garbage, having passed through a very expensive machine, is somehow enobled and none dare criticize it.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.content: Old programmers never die.  They just branch to a new address.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.content: The past always looks better than it was.  It's only pleasant because it isn't here.
quotes.author: Finley Peter Dunne (Mr. Dooley)
